author: J. K. Rowling
name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: Harry Potter goes on a journey with his 2 best friends to find the sorcerer's stone that Voldemort is after.

author: Rick Riordan
name: The Lightning Theif
description: Percy Jackson finds out that his father is none other than Poseidon and has to prove his innnocence to the Olympian king Zeus.

author: C. S. Lewis
name: The Lion, The Witch, and The Wardrobe
description: The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe is where four siblings discover a magical land called Narnia through a wardrobe, where they join the battle against the evil White Witch with the help of the majestic lion, Aslan.

author: George R. R. Martin
name: A Game of Thrones
description: Game of Thrones, the first book in Ice and Fire series, is a medieval-inspired fantasy novel where noble houses compete for control in a land threatened by dark forces from the North.

author: J. R. R. Tolkien
name: The Fellowship of the Ring
description: The Fellowship of the Ring, the first volume in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, follows Frodo Baggins and a diverse group of companions on a perilous journey to destroy a powerful ring that could plunge Middle-earth into eternal darkness.

author: Suzanne Collins
name: Hunger Games
description: The Hunger Games is where protagonist Katniss Everdeen volunteers to participate in a televised fight-to-the-death competition in a society that uses the games for control and entertainment.

author: Stephenie Meyer
name: Twilight, Book 1: Twilight
description: Twilight, the first book in the Twilight series, chronicles the forbidden romance between mortal Bella Swan and the enigmatic vampire, Edward Cullen, in the rain-soaked town of Forks, Washington.

author: Takehiko Inoue
name: Vagabond
description: Vagabond depicts the life and journey of Miyamoto Musashi, one of Japan's most legendary swordsmen, as he seeks mastery in the way of the sword and personal enlightenment.
